source.p: Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video.

div.h3:
CLICK HERE for COVID-19 School Updates
Principal’s Message
div.p:
Dear Parents and Students,
Welcome to Sterling High School for the 2019-20 school year! We are thrilled about our successes and anticipate that this year will be even better than the previous years. We welcome the incoming Freshmen, Class of 2023, to the Castle.
Sterling High School has a competent, caring staff, and they are prepared to assess each student’s learning style and abilities and to coordinate activities that will enhance every student’s academic growth. Through well-planned, collaborative sessions of school-wide, departmental, and district professional development initiatives, teachers share and implement research-based strategies that promise to motivate and educate students in reaching their fullest potential. We encourage you to inform our teachers of any needs or concerns your child may have so that we may provide each student an opportunity to have a productive and rewarding experience.
Please take an active role and interest in your child’s education by accessing OnCourse, reviewing the Student Handbook, and attending Back to School Nights and Parent Teacher Conferences. I encourage all students to download the APP for Sterling High School and the StopIt APP.
Finally, we are excited about the recent upgrades to our school. We encourage you to attend co-curricular events to see for yourself how wonderful our campus is. We are ready for the challenge to make great things happen and look forward to a great school year!
School’s Mission Statement:
Sterling Regional High School District will serve the needs of a diverse student body by maintaining a safe and respectful learning environment, cultivating high standards of excellence, and preparing our students for life beyond high school.
Educationally yours,
Matthew Sheehan, Principal
Sterling High School
501 S. Warwick Road
Somerdale, NJ 08083
Phone: (856) 784-1333

span.style: font-size: 10pt; margin: 6px 0px 4px; display: inline !important; font-family: Arial;
